text: It was definitely the best experience for me to play the Triology in Hypermode (hardest difficulty). text: I like #2 as much as Prime #1, and 3: Corruption is my least fav of the 3, though it is still pretty good.

text: im glad echoes was bestowed the game of the year back in the days, even dark samus was honored to be the best villain. this game is truly a masterpiece and i will always remember this game by heart to the day i die. not a day has been passed do i not think about this game. author: John Herbert

text: its funny how the music feels so organic when running round in the Prime games, even though in real life the places would be silent....unless. Is Samus playing this music inside her visor??
author: wgwilson

text: DissociativeIdentity the trilogy loses much of its magic when you take the music away. I played a "realistic" playthrough with it all off, and I was very........bored. What makes this trilogy amazing is literally everything. You take one aspect away, and, you're left with a shell.
author: Whisperedflame

text: People always get so scared because the light/dark beams have ammo.  They are very destructive weapons and the fact that you are hesitant to use them is a good indicator as to why you are struggling.
author: chrisman223

text: I see a lot of comments talking about the beam ammo system in this game. Not trying to sound arrogant, but I never had a problem keeping my ammo reserves at a comfortable level. I will say, though, I was a pack rat when it came to ammo the first time I played. I enjoyed the game infinitely more when I stopped being a pack rat and just used my light and dark beams as I needed them.
author: Agent 005

text: I played Prime 2 before either of the others, which is probably I think of it more positively than most people do.  I enjoyed the challenge and I thought the dark world was a nice spin on things
author: oxy612

text: my only response to your response, is that I LOVE YOUR NAME!!!!!! :D
author: purplepotatochipPPC

text: It's unfortunate they took the route of beams with ammo, confusing not exactly coherent storyline that only has relation to the Metroid universe through the Galactic federation, Samus and Metroid prime herself...
author: Arexsis

text: That reason would be that Metroids of any kind scare all of us in the 3D games. Them and the Valhalla proved to me that I will never be able to play a horror game...
author: PrincessTrevor2

text: I found Prime 2 much harder than Prime 1. I say that because i haven't finished it, it's hard to replenish my light and dark beam, and for some reason, Dark Metroids freak me the hell out!
author: purplepotatochipPPC

text:
I had the same problem, after playing prime 1, this one seemed out of place with its ammo system. However biting through it with the support of a friend who is a major fan of the series, I found that the game is amazing in so many ways. He actualy convinced me to play the classics when i finished the trilogy.
Long story short, I have played every single Metroid game I could find...
author: Mister Buttchulon

text: one thing i really like about the prime series, is that it has longer tracks, so you hear less repeating and more awesome music... makes things far less annoying
author: kamakazikilla

text: Same! I dun know why,but the wet landscape just seemed appealing to me.:3
author: Josh Goudy

text: I blasted through this game really quickly in 2005. I can barely remember the music but I loved getting the spin jump finally. I remember struggling with some of the bosses and fetching different artifacts was not as fun as the first one. Still a great game. I got the trilogy for a friend and they never played it. I think I'll ask to borrow it.
author: Postmita

text: I listen to that while cruising in a early, chilly morning through the dead silent Alps with sunrays hitting the snow from above.

text: I'd say that Metroid 2 and Echoes would be tied for that.  I honestly don't get why people are in love with corruption, but that's just me.  It was so much more linear compared to 1 and 2, and and felt more robotic in atmosphere and the ending was lame.

text: ...I never realized how fond my memories of playing this series are until just now, when I looked at this screen of behind-the-visor Samus just standing and looking at the dark beauty before her--something so common in these games. text: @Masz52 I try to 100% everything, not to mention I count the moments I spend taking in the scenery,. author: SwagJerryRice

text:
It's funny. I don't like Prime 2 that much when I compare it to Prime and Prime 3, but it's still got this place in gaming history for me. It was the game I never finished for a long while, because I thought it was too hard. Then I came back at it later and learned to stop being such a stick in the mud with my light and dark beams, and the game just opened up.

This song is probably an explanation as to how the game makes me feel. Ominous, yet relaxing. It reassures you, even when you're afraid.
author: UmbreonMessiah

text: it may not be as good as the first prime but damn, i love this game. the atmosphere was awesome.

text: I find this funny. I love the music but as this is very much ambient music, it can trace its lineage all the way back to composer Erik Satie in the nineteenth century. sure it's much more electronic and modern, but the ambient music school of composition can easily be traced back to him.

text:
This game is pretty good. But to be honest, I enjoyed the first one a lot more. For one, I never beat this game. I got stuck on the Dark World boss that is basically a ball and you have to fight it as a morph ball (soooo hard!). But yeah, the first one is superior in environment/ambiance and music.

I have yet to play the 3rd one, but I really would like to someday.
author: TheHarmonixer

text: This game would've been better if it actually let you explore the world and play the actual game without burning to death 90% of the time. I mean yes they fixed the problem, but only in the literal last hour out of 30 hours.

text: Damn those fucking Grenchlers, ESPECIALLY the dark ones. Honestly Torvus was right up there with Sanctuary, can't deny that.
author: DukeOnkledNukem

text:
Haha, great timing, I was just playing my hard mode run of this game. (Well, second attempt at it anyway, my first got lost due to memory card corruption before I could finish it)

I've really grown to appreciate MP2's music lately. When playing the game it was just background noise to me, but I really like it now that I've stopped to really listen to it.
author: Masz52

text: So many memories, I felt so il-at-ease playing this game knowing somewhere, something was coming for me and I couldn't run from it. beautiful music, wonderful game.
author: Stephen Lee

text: This level made me rage so much D: Agon Wastes and the Sanctuary were a breeze compared to this.
author: JelloApocalypse

text: I think this is as far as I got before I decided I didn't want to waste my time playing this subpar game.
author: drunyon214

text: I actually just finished watching a Let's Play of this, actually. slowbeef's, to be precise. He HATED Torvus Bog. |D Never brought up the music, though.
author: Darkly

text:
The game as a whole wasn't great, it detracted way too far from the original, but it did have some great songs like the first one did. This one definitely being the best song in the game, if only they replaced the dark world with more light world areas... imagine how the game could be twice as big.

All that being said, this game is annoying at best. Metroid Prime 1 was a masterpiece, Metroid Prime 2 was annoying and frustrating, and Metroid Prime 3 was good but way too easy and short.
author: genesisSOC

text: My favorite track of MP2. Remember taking the long way just to hear the song near the end of the game :-D
author: Greenboom98

text: I was pretty edgy playing through this when I was younger, but when I got here the song calmed me down.
author: Sephiko

text: *___* I remember standing there and watching the rain falling
author: BerndSchleier

text: Probably my favorite place in the game with the Sanctuary. Coupled with this ambient track, the area was very atmospheric. I should replay this game someday, it feels like I went through it too quickly. It had some pretty awesome boss fights, but I remember not being a fan of the dark/light world gameplay, at least until you get a certain suit.
